meanings.definition: Not having received the sacrament of confession or absolution before death.
meanings.sent1: The unhouseled man passed away without confessing his sins.
meanings.sent2: The priest made sure no soul left unhouseled in the village.
meanings.sent3: The unhouseled ghost wandered the halls seeking peace.
meanings.sent4: Her unhouseled secrets haunted her even in death.
meanings.sent5: The unhouseled spirit lingered in the old church, restless and sorrowful.

meanings.definition: Not having been provided with shelter or housing.
meanings.sent1: The unhouseled family slept on the streets during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The kind stranger offered a warm meal to the unhouseled woman.
meanings.sent3: The unhouseled cat found refuge in the abandoned building.
meanings.sent4: His unhouseled condition made him appreciate every roof over his head.
meanings.sent5: The unhouseled puppy wagged its tail gratefully as it was taken in by a loving family.
